virtual BOOLEAN HttpWapMgrBase::CancelHttp (  INT  conn_id,
INT  requ_id
)  [pure virtual]
 

Used by the application to cancel an outstanding request.

There must be an outstanding request in order for this function to Succeed.

Parameters:
conn_id Identifier of the HTTP connection. Will be issued by HttpWapMgr and allows an HttpHandler to identify itself in function calls.
requ_id Id of request to cancel.
Returns:
Success of method.

Implemented in HttpWapMgrPlugin.

virtual BOOLEAN HttpWapMgrBase::CloseHttp (  INT  conn_id  )  [pure virtual]
 

Used by the application to close the HTTP connection.

HTTP connection must be open in order for this function to succeed. Function will cancel all outstanding requests.

Parameters:
conn_id Identifier of the HTTP connection. Will be issued by HttpWapMgr and allows an HttpHandler to identify itself in function calls.
Returns:
Success of method.

Implemented in HttpWapMgrPlugin.

virtual BOOLEAN HttpWapMgrBase::DecodeMessage (  const Message &  msg,
INT &  conn_id,
INT &  requ_id,
INT &  status,
WString &  header,
BinData **  body,
INT &  more,
INT &  length,
WString &  url
)  [pure virtual]
 

This Method is called by the Application each time it gets a message in the form of msg class. This method decodes the message and fills the appropriate fields

Parameters:
msg The message handed in
conn_id Connection id this will be filled by Plugin class
requ_id request id this will be filled by Plugin class
status status to be filled by the Plugin class
header header to be filled by the Plugin class by NULL or with value depending upono the Messages Type
body body this will be filled by Plugin class
more indicates if more data is following this packet or not
length length of he data recived filling depends upon the message type
url to be filled in by the Plugin calls depending upon the message type
Returns:
Sucess of the method

Implemented in HttpWapMgrPlugin.

virtual BOOLEAN HttpWapMgrBase::OpenHttp (  INT &  conn_id,
INT  pr_id
)  [pure virtual]
 

Used by application to open the HTTP connection.

Parameters:
conn_id Identifier of the HTTP connection. Will be issued by HttpWapMgr and allows an HttpHandler to identify itself in function calls. Value is > 0.
pr_id Id of WapProfile to be used. (WapProfile determines if connection is secure/non-secure and connection-oriented/ connectionless)
Returns:
Success of method.

Implemented in HttpWapMgrPlugin.

virtual BOOLEAN HttpWapMgrBase::RegisterWap (  const INT &  conn_id,
INT  pr_id,
WString &  mime,
INT  app_id
)  [pure virtual]
 

Used to register for WAP push messages.

Function may be called again after a call to wapUnregister.

Parameters:
conn_id Identifier of the WAP connection. Will be issued and allows a WapHandler to identify itself in function calls. Value is > 0.
pr_id Id of WapProfile to be used (WapProfile determines if connection is secure/non-secure and connection-oriented/ connectionless).
mime MIME type supported by registering application.
app_id Application id according to Open Mobile Naming Authority (OMNA), defaults to 0.
Returns:
Success of method.

Implemented in HttpWapMgrPlugin.

virtual BOOLEAN HttpWapMgrBase::RequestGetHttp (  INT  conn_id,
INT &  requ_id,
const CHAR *  URL,
const CHAR *  header
)  [pure virtual]
 

Used by the application to initiate an HTTP GET request.

httpOpen must have been called first.

Parameters:
conn_id Identifier of the HTTP connection. Will be issued by HttpWapMgr and allows an HttpHandler to identify itself in function calls.
requ_id Identifier of the HTTP request. Will be returned by HttpHandler.
URL The requested URL (e.g. "172.36.25.3").
header Application may supply header values to be used in the request.
Returns:
Success of method.

Implemented in HttpWapMgrPlugin.

virtual BOOLEAN HttpWapMgrBase::RequestPostDataHttp (  INT  conn_id,
INT &  requ_id,
BinData *  body,
INT  more
)  [pure virtual]
 

Used by application to supply more body data for an HTTP POST request.

httpRequestPost must have been called first.

Parameters:
conn_id Identifier of the HTTP connection. Will be issued by HttpWapMgr and allows an HttpHandler to identify itself in function calls.
body Container with any type of data to be sent in an HTTP POST request.
more Application can set more to 1 if it wants to supply more body content using the HttpRequestData method. Request will be sent only as soon as entire body is complete (indicated by more being 0).
Returns:
Success of method.

Implemented in HttpWapMgrPlugin.

virtual BOOLEAN HttpWapMgrBase::RequestPostHttp (  INT  conn_id,
INT &  requ_id,
const CHAR *  URL,
const CHAR *  header,
BinData *  body,
INT  more
)  [pure virtual]
 

Used by the application to initiate an HTTP POST request.

httpOpen must have been called first.

Parameters:
conn_id Identifier of the HTTP connection. Will be issued by HttpWapMgr and allows an HttpHandler to identify itself in function calls.
requ_id Identifier of the HTTP request. Will be returned by HttpHandler.
URL The requested URL (e.g. "172.36.25.3").
header Application may supply header values to be used in the request.
body Container with any type of data to be sent in an HTTP POST request.
more Application can set more to 1 if it wants to supply more body content using the httpRequestPost Data method. Request will be sent only as soon as entire body is complete (indicated by more being 0).
Returns:
Success of method.

Implemented in HttpWapMgrPlugin.

virtual BOOLEAN HttpWapMgrBase::ResumeHttp (  INT  conn_id  )  [pure virtual]
 

Used by the application to resume the HTTP connection.

HTTP connection must be open in order for this function to succeed. Functionality is implementation specific.

Parameters:
conn_id Identifier of the HTTP connection. Will be issued by HttpWapMgr and allows an HttpHandler to identify itself in function calls.
Returns:
Success of method.

Implemented in HttpWapMgrPlugin.

virtual BOOLEAN HttpWapMgrBase::UnregisterWap (  const INT &  conn_id  )  [pure virtual]
 

Used by the application to unregister for WAP push messages.

WAP connection must be open in order for this function to succeed. wapRegister must have been called before. Function will cancel all outstanding requests.

Parameters:
conn_id Identifier of the WAP connection, conn_id was returned by wapRegister method.
Returns:
Success of method.

Implemented in HttpWapMgrPlugin.
